Title: [Dashboard][KPI Widgets]Verify that User can prevent recursive KPI overlay expansion successfully
Description: Verify KPI overlay expansion prevention functionality
Precondition: 1. User is logged into the system; 2. User has access to KPI dashboard; 3. KPI widgets are visible and functional
Steps: 1. Navigate to KPI dashboard; 2. Locate KPI widget with expand icon; 3. Click expand icon to open overlay; 4. Verify overlay expands successfully; 5. Attempt to click expand icon again; 6. Check expand icon state; 7. Verify no duplicate overlays created
Expected Result: 1. Dashboard loads with KPI widgets visible; 2. Expand icon is visible and accessible; 3. Overlay expands and displays content; 4. Overlay is fully expanded and functional; 5. Expand action is triggered; 6. Expand icon is disabled or hidden; 7. Only single overlay exists
Test Data: Environment: KPI Dashboard; Test Data: Multiple KPI widgets with expand functionality

Title: [Dashboard][Info Icons]Verify that User can view stable info icon positioning successfully
Description: Verify info icon position stability during hover actions
Precondition: 1. User is logged into the system; 2. User has access to KPI dashboard; 3. KPI widgets with info icons are visible
Steps: 1. Navigate to KPI dashboard; 2. Locate KPI widget with info icon; 3. Hover over info icon on any tile; 4. Observe icon position stability; 5. Move mouse away and back; 6. Check icon remains in same position; 7. Verify no floating or shifting occurs
Expected Result: 1. Dashboard loads with KPI widgets visible; 2. Info icon is visible and accessible; 3. Hover action is triggered successfully; 4. Icon position remains stable during hover; 5. Mouse movement is detected; 6. Icon maintains exact position; 7. No position shifting or floating observed
Test Data: Environment: KPI Dashboard; Test Data: KPI widgets with info icons; Resolution: Common browser resolutions

Title: [Dashboard][Tooltips]Verify that User can view properly aligned tooltip arrows successfully
Description: Verify tooltip arrow alignment accuracy and consistency
Precondition: 1. User is logged into the system; 2. User has access to KPI dashboard; 3. KPI widgets with info icons are visible
Steps: 1. Navigate to KPI dashboard; 2. Locate KPI widget with info icon; 3. Click info icon to display tooltip; 4. Check tooltip arrow position; 5. Verify arrow points to icon center; 6. Test multiple info icons; 7. Confirm consistent arrow alignment
Expected Result: 1. Dashboard loads with KPI widgets visible; 2. Info icon is visible and clickable; 3. Tooltip displays successfully; 4. Arrow position is visible and clear; 5. Arrow points accurately to icon center; 6. Multiple tooltips display correctly; 7. All arrows maintain consistent alignment
Test Data: Environment: KPI Dashboard; Test Data: Multiple KPI widgets with info icons; Resolution: Various screen sizes

Title: [Dashboard][Tooltip Positioning]Verify that User can view properly positioned tooltips without overflow successfully
Description: Verify tooltip positioning and overflow prevention on corner widgets
Precondition: 1. User is logged into the system; 2. User has access to KPI dashboard; 3. Dashboard has widgets in bottom-right corner
Steps: 1. Navigate to KPI dashboard; 2. Locate widgets in bottom-right corner; 3. Click info icon on corner widget; 4. Check tooltip positioning; 5. Verify tooltip flips if needed; 6. Test tooltip visibility; 7. Confirm no scrollbars appear
Expected Result: 1. Dashboard loads with corner widgets visible; 2. Corner widgets are accessible; 3. Info icon click triggers tooltip; 4. Tooltip positions correctly; 5. Tooltip flips position if needed; 6. Tooltip remains fully visible; 7. No scrollbars or overflow issues
Test Data: Environment: KPI Dashboard; Test Data: Dashboard with widgets in bottom-right corner; Resolution: Common resolutions

Title: [Dashboard][Scrollbar Management]Verify that User can view dashboard without unnecessary scrollbars successfully
Description: Verify scrollbar behavior and content fitting across different resolutions
Precondition: 1. User is logged into the system; 2. User has access to KPI dashboard; 3. Dashboard content fits within viewport
Steps: 1. Navigate to KPI dashboard; 2. Open dashboard at common resolutions; 3. Check for vertical scrollbar presence; 4. Verify content fits viewport; 5. Test different screen sizes; 6. Confirm scrollbar behavior; 7. Validate no unnecessary scrollbars
Expected Result: 1. Dashboard loads successfully; 2. Common resolutions are supported; 3. Scrollbar presence is checked; 4. Content fits within viewport; 5. Multiple screen sizes work; 6. Scrollbar behavior is correct; 7. No unnecessary scrollbars appear
Test Data: Environment: KPI Dashboard; Test Data: Common resolutions: 1920x1080; 1366x768; 1440x900; 1600x900

Title: [Dashboard][Tenancy Access]Verify that User can view correct KPI access labels based on tenancy successfully
Description: Verify KPI access label display based on tenancy configuration
Precondition: 1. User is logged into the system; 2. User has access to widget store; 3. KPI configuration is properly set
Steps: 1. Navigate to KPI widget store; 2. View KPI cards for various tenancies; 3. Check KPI access labels; 4. Verify Free label display; 5. Verify Premium label display; 6. Test different tenancy types; 7. Confirm label accuracy
Expected Result: 1. Widget store loads successfully; 2. KPI cards are visible for tenancies; 3. Access labels are displayed; 4. Free KPIs show Free label; 5. Premium KPIs show Premium label; 6. Different tenancies work correctly; 7. All labels display accurately
Test Data: Environment: KPI Widget Store; Test Data: Various tenancy types; KPI config: Free and Premium settings

Title: [Dashboard][Tenancy Permissions]Verify that User can view only permitted KPIs based on tenancy allocation successfully
Description: Verify KPI visibility and access control based on tenancy settings
Precondition: 1. User is logged into the system; 2. User has access to KPI dashboard; 3. Tenancy-specific KPI configuration is set
Steps: 1. Log in with each tenancy type; 2. Review visible KPIs per tenancy; 3. Check Revenue Contribution visibility; 4. Verify Job Summary access; 5. Test Trip Volume display; 6. Confirm Business Profitability access; 7. Validate all KPI permissions
Expected Result: 1. Login successful for each tenancy; 2. KPI visibility is checked per tenancy; 3. Revenue Contribution shows for Free tenancies; 4. Job Summary accessible for all tenancies; 5. Trip Volume visible for Free tenancies; 6. Business Profitability shows Premium tag; 7. All KPI permissions are correct
Test Data: Environment: KPI Dashboard; Test Data: Tenancies: JKLL; Advantis; DIMO; HMSC; CDSG; Ceyline; KPI Types: Free and Premium

Expected Result: 1. Dashboard loads with Premium KPIs visible; 2. Premium KPI configuration is loaded; 3. Premium tags are displayed; 4. Tag text shows Premium correctly; 5. Multiple Premium KPIs work; 6. All Premium tags are consistent; 7. Premium tag visibility is confirmed
Test Data: Environment: KPI Dashboard; Test Data: Premium KPI configuration; Tag format: Premium (Try Free for 3 Months)
